Quote: The place to improve the world is first in one's own heart and head and hands.
Author: Robert M. Pirsig

Quote: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.
Author: Don Marquis

Quote: All men have a sweetness in their life. That is what helps them go on. It is towards that they turn when they feel too worn out.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: You give before you get.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
Author: Mignon McLaughlin

Quote: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

Quote: Without passion man is a mere latent force and possibility, like the flint which awaits the shock of the iron before it can give forth its spark.
Author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

Quote: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
Author: Peter Drucker

Quote: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
Author: Pauline Kael

Quote: The future is completely open, and we are writing it moment to moment.
Author: Pema Chödrön

Quote: We need never be ashamed of our tears.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
Author: Edgar Allan Poe

Quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
Author: Hal Abelson

Quote: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.
Author: Anna Pavlova

Quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
Author: Camillo Benso, Count of Cavour

Quote: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
Author: Thomas Hardy

Quote: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
Author: Confucius

Quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
Author: John Lubbock

Quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: There are two kinds of failures: those who thought and never did, and those who did and never thought.
Author: Laurence J. Peter

Quote: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
Author: Diogenes

Quote: Whatever happens, take responsibility.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
Author: John Barrymore

Quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
Author: Shirley MacLaine

Quote: To lead people walk behind them.
Author: Laozi

Quote: The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: The years teach much which the days never know.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Accept challenges, so that you may feel the exhilaration of victory.
Author: George S. Patton

Quote: The exercise of an extraordinary gift is the supremist pleasure in life.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Don't settle for a relationship that won't let you be yourself.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: To have much learning and skill, to be well-trained in discipline, and good in speech — this is the highest blessing.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: No garden is without its weeds.
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quote: To change one's life, start immediately, do it flamboyantly, no exceptions.
Author: William James

Quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody else has thought.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Something opens our wings. Something makes boredom and hurt disappear. Someone fills the cup in front of us: We taste only sacredness.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Imagination is the living power and prime agent of all human perception.
Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Quote: It is the quality of our work which will please God, not the quantity.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.
Author: Marie Curie

Quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is equivalent to magic.
Author: Arthur C. Clarke

Quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quote: In the sky there are no tracks. Outside there is no recluse. There are no conditioned things that are eternal. There is no instability in the Buddhas.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
Author: Peter Drucker

Quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
Author: Augustine of Hippo

Quote: If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?
Author: Joe Namath

Quote: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
Author: Ovid

Quote: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
Author: Bernard Shaw

Quote: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.
Author: John Berry

Quote: Reason and free inquiry are the only effectual agents against error.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
Author: Søren Kierkegaard

Quote: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
Author: Jerome

Quote: Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
Author: Thomas Carlyle

Quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
Author: Bob Feller

Quote: Error is discipline through which we advance.
Author: William Ellery Channing

Quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
Author: Joseph Joubert

Quote: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
Author: Mencius

Quote: We are all something, but none of us are everything.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
Author: Helen Keller

Quote: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters. Excellence is not an exception; it is a prevailing attitude.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

Quote: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
Author: Colin Powell

Quote: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
Author: Satchel Paige

Quote: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.
Author: Calvin Coolidge

Quote: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
Author: Confucius

Quote: There is nothing happens to any person but what was in his power to go through with.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
Author: Og Mandino

Quote: One of the tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
Author: Olivier Messiaen

Quote: I will prepare and someday my chance will come.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
Author: Lou Holtz

Quote: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
Author: Lucretius

Quote: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody else has thought.
Author: Jonathan Swift

Quote: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
Author: Confucius

Quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
Author: Erasmus

Quote: A passion for politics stems usually from an insatiable need, either for power, or for friendship and adulation, or a combination of both.
Author: Fawn M. Brodie

Quote: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
Author: Jim Morrison

Quote: Ideals are an imaginative understanding of that which is desirable in that which is possible.
Author: Walter Lippmann

Quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
Author: Hannah More

Quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
Author: Carol Burnett

Quote: More often than not, anger is actually an indication of weakness rather than of strength.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
Author: William Burroughs

Quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
Author: Cicero

Quote: Ignorance never settles a question.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.
Author: Mark Goulston

Quote: Even an animal, if you show genuine affection, gradually trust develops... If you always showing bad face and beating, how can you develop friendship?
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Quote: I cannot always control what goes on outside. But I can always control what goes on inside.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Always be smarter than the people who hire you.
Author: Lena Horne

Quote: The truth you believe and cling to makes you unavailable to hear anything new.
Author: Pema Chödrön

Quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
Author: Ralph Marston

Quote: I'm a great believer in luck and I find the harder I work, the more I have of it.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Happiness mainly comes from our own attitude, rather than from external factors.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
Author: Confucius

Quote: A lot of people give up just before theyre about to make it. You know you never know when that next obstacle is going to be the last one.
Author: Chuck Norris

Quote: The price of greatness is responsibility.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
Author: Jim Rohn

Quote: The moment one gives close attention to anything, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: If I find 10,000 ways something won't work, I haven't failed. I am not discouraged, because every wrong attempt discarded is another step forward.
Author: Thomas Edison

Quote: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
Author: Cicero

Quote: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
Author: William Blake

Quote: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: If only wed stop trying to be happy wed have a pretty good time.
Author: Edith Wharton

Quote: Technology is a word that describes something that doesn't work yet.
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: Change in all things is sweet.
Author: Aristotle

Quote: We are Divine enough to ask and we are important enough to receive.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: How is it possible to find meaning in a finite world, given my waist and shirt size?
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: If A is success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The past has no power to stop you from being present now. Only your grievance about the past can do that.
Author: Eckhart Tolle

Quote: Think for yourselves and let others enjoy the privilege to do so too.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
Author: Vernon Cooper

Quote: Time you enjoyed wasting was not wasted.
Author: John Lennon

Quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
Author: Hubert Humphrey

Quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
Author: Erasmus

Quote: Mountains cannot be surmounted except by winding paths.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
Author: Sam Walton

Quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
Author: Mark Twain

Quote: Be great in act, as you have been in thought.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: I am not bothered by the fact that I am unknown. I am bothered when I do not know others.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
Author: William Cowper

Quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
Author: Larry Elder

Quote: Today you are you! That is truer than true! There is no one alive who is you-er than you!
Author: Dr. Seuss

Quote: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Meditation is the dissolution of thoughts in eternal awareness or Pure consciousness without objectification, knowing without thinking, merging finitude in infinity.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: There is no way to prosperity, prosperity is the way.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Most people are about as happy as they make up their minds to be
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
Author: Ernie Banks

Quote: Every friendship is different because everyone's personality is different.
Author: Nargis Fakhri

Quote: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
Author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

Quote: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
Author: Euripides

Quote: Meaning is not what you start with but what you end up with.
Author: Peter Elbow

Quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
Author: Henry Ford

Quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
Author: Jean de La Fontaine

Quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
Author: Carol Burnett

Quote: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue
Author: Confucius

Quote: The cause is hidden. The effect is visible to all.
Author: Ovid

Quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
Author: Walt Disney

Quote: Appearances are often deceiving.
Author: Aesop

Quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Author: Confucius

Quote: You're not obligated to win. You're obligated to keep trying to do the best you can every day.
Author: Marian Wright Edelman

Quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
Author: William Burroughs

Quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you and love the people with whom fate brings you together but do so with all your heart.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: No alibi will save you from accepting the responsibility.
Author: Napoleon Hill

Quote: Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.
Author: Albert Camus

Quote: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Not what we have but what we enjoy constitutes our abundance.
Author: Jean Antoine Petit-Senn

Quote: All know the way; few actually walk it.
Author: Bodhidharma

Quote: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
Author: Robert Louis Stevenson

Quote: Be not afraid of greatness: some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: It is far better to be alone, than to be in bad company.
Author: George Washington

Quote: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
Author: Swami Vivekananda

Quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
Author: Charles Caleb Colton

Quote: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or airplane or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
Author: John Burroughs

Quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
Author: Aldous Huxley

Quote: You can't let praise or criticism get to you. It's a weakness to get caught up in either one.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quote: We do not quit playing because we grow old, we grow old because we quit playing.
Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

Quote: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
Author: Henry Ward Beecher

Quote: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: The person who lives life fully, glowing with life's energy, is the person who lives a successful life.
Author: Daisaku Ikeda

Quote: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
Author: Miguel de Cervantes

Quote: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.
Author: Robert Southey

Quote: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
Author: Christopher Reeve

Quote: Let the future tell the truth and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
Author: Nikola Tesla

Quote: Consider that not only do negative thoughts and emotions destroy our experience of peace, but they also undermine our health.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Peace begins with a smile.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quote: I believe that every person is born with talent.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed people can change the world. Indeed. It is the only thing that ever has.
Author: Margaret Mead

Quote: None knows the weight of another's burden.
Author: George Herbert

Quote: The simplest things are often the truest.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: We must never forget that it is through our actions, words, and thoughts that we have a choice.
Author: Sogyal Rinpoche

Quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches but reveal to them their own.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: More often than not, anger is actually an indication of weakness rather than of strength.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
Author: Henri Nouwen

Quote: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: You should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body, and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time. That’s how to get rid of resentment for that person.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
Author: Thomas Hobbes

Quote: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
Author: Michelle Obama

Quote: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.
Author: Anna Pavlova

Quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
Author: Napoleon

Quote: Almost everything comes from nothing.
Author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

Quote: If a man going down into a river, swollen and swiftly flowing, is carried away by the current — how can he help others across? – The Buddha
Author: The Buddha

Quote: I took a speed-reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: It's only when the tide goes out that you discover who's been swimming naked.
Author: Warren Buffett

Quote: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.
Author: Hannah Arendt

Quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
Author: Confucius

Quote: The path to success is to take massive, determined action.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
Author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

Quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
Author: Theodore Roosevelt

Quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
Author: Oprah Winfrey

Quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quote: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
Author: Afrika Bambaataa

Quote: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
Author: Marcia Fudge

Quote: The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
Author: Eden Phillpotts

Quote: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Take time to deliberate, but when the time for action has arrived, stop thinking and go in.
Author: Napoleon

Quote: Never idealize others. They will never live up to your expectations.
Author: Leo Buscaglia

Quote: Intuition will tell the thinking mind where to look next.
Author: Jonas Salk

Quote: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
Author: Masayoshi Son

Quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
Author: Morihei Ueshiba

Quote: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
Author: Thomas Fuller

Quote: Truth, and goodness, and beauty are but different faces of the same all.
Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

Quote: Our lives are a sum total of the choices we have made.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
Author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

Quote: With pride, there are many curses. With humility, there come many blessings.
Author: Ezra Taft Benson

Quote: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
Author: Hermann Hesse

Quote: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quote: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
Author: Leonardo da Vinci

Quote: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
Author: Laozi

Quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
Author: Lord Byron

Quote: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
Author: François de La Rochefoucauld

Quote: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
Author: Winston Churchill

Quote: Your friend is your needs answered.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
Author: Ansel Adams

Quote: All our talents increase in the using, and every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
Author: Anne Brontë

Quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
Author: Albert Schweitzer

Quote: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
Author: Lucille Ball

Quote: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of the imagination.
Author: John Dewey

Quote: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Think as a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
Author: Kahlil Gibran

Quote: There is no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love; there's only scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
Author: Wayne Dyer

Quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
Author: Confucius

Quote: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
Author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

Quote: If one is lucky, a solitary fantasy can totally transform one million realities.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
Author: Chuck Swindoll

Quote: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: Eternal nothingness is fine if you happen to be dressed for it.
Author: Woody Allen

Quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
Author: Rumi

Quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
Author: John Wooden

Quote: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
Author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

Quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
Author: Confucius

Quote: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
Author: Howard H. Aiken

Quote: The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
Author: Ernie Banks

Quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: Be as you wish to seem.
Author: Socrates

Quote: Don't ruin the present with the ruined past.
Author: Ellen Gilchrist

Quote: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Friendship with oneself is all important because without it one cannot be friends with anybody else in the world.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
Author: Dale Carnegie

Quote: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
Author: Mortimer J. Adler

Quote: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
Author: The Buddha

Quote: We make our own fortunes and we call them fate.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
Author: Isocrates

Quote: The winner ain't the one with the fastest car it's the one who refuses to lose.
Author: Dale Earnhardt

Quote: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
Author: Jared Diamond

Quote: You teach best what you most need to learn.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
Author: Chuck Swindoll

Quote: An invasion of armies can be resisted, but not an idea whose time has come.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
Author: Laozi

Quote: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
Author: Sidney Hook

Quote: He who angers you conquers you.
Author: Elizabeth Kenny

Quote: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: As you think, so shall you become.
Author: Bruce Lee

Quote: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
Author: Voltaire

Quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
Author: Joan Didion

Quote: I'll prepare and someday my chance will come.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quote: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
Author: Jane Addams

Quote: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
Author: Margaret Cousins

Quote: If one is estranged from oneself, then one is estranged from others too. If one is out of touch with oneself, then one cannot touch others.
Author: Anne Lindbergh

Quote: No day in which you learn something is a complete loss.
Author: David Eddings

Quote: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
Author: Anatole France

Quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Author: Eleanor Roosevelt

Quote: There is never enough time to do everything, but there is always enough time to do the most important thing.
Author: Brian Tracy

Quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
Author: Elbert Hubbard

Quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
Author: Confucius

Quote: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: The way we communicate with others and with ourselves ultimately determines the quality of our lives.
Author: Tony Robbins

Quote: Learning is finding out what you already know.
Author: Richard Bach

Quote: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
Author: Joyce Meyer

Quote: Tennis is a perfect combination of violent action taking place in an atmosphere of total tranquillity.
Author: Billie Jean King

Quote: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
Author: Michel de Montaigne

Quote: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quote: Never complain and never explain.
Author: Benjamin Disraeli

Quote: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
Author: Carl Jung

Quote: If you're trying to create a company, it's like baking a cake. You have to have all the ingredients in the right proportion.
Author: Elon Musk

Quote: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
Author: Ed Cunningham

Quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
Author: Laozi

Quote: By believing passionately in something that does not yet exist, we create it.
Author: Nikos Kazantzakis

Quote: All know the way; few actually walk it.
Author: Bodhidharma

Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Author: Isocrates

Quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
Author: Seneca the Younger

Quote: The most precious gift we can offer anyone is our attention. When mindfulness embraces those we love, they will bloom like flowers.
Author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

Quote: Stay away from what might have been and look at what will be.
Author: Marsha Petrie Sue

Quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
Author: Samuel Johnson

Quote: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
Author: Camillo Benso, Count of Cavour

Quote: The greatest obstacle to connecting with our joy is resentment.
Author: Pema Chödrön

Quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: It is not enough to have a good mind; the main thing is to use it well.
Author: René Descartes

Quote: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
Author: Joseph Campbell

Quote: God made me fast. And when I run, I feel His pleasure.
Author: Eric Liddell

Quote: By living deeply in the present moment we can understand the past better and we can prepare for a better future.
Author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

Quote: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
Author: Nelson Mandela

Quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
Author: William Butler Yeats

Quote: Beauty is a pattern that our minds recognize, but don't fully understand.
Author: Me
